answers.answer: Hi, Can't really said that the symptoms you are experiencing are from the high sugar levels.  But it could, as uncontrollable blood sugar can lead to nerve damage which could lead to pain in your feet.  With your symptoms of foot swells--this is due to fluid retention.  I strongly recommend you to go see a doctor for it to have a full investigation..in case it is a heart problem.  There is no way you are put it off, you have to see a doctor emergent even if the symptoms goes away.  you don't want this to lead to a serious problem later.

question: I was diagnosed with type 2 on june 16 2009.  I have been on metformin 500 1per day, and have started eating according to what the ADA wants us to and losing weight slowly.  I have noticed  that some days my left foot swells... and hurts... my shoulders and feet have pins and needle feelings... i get severe  side cramps in the rib area(not all the time) ...is this from the diabetes... my numbers run from 89 to 139 ... and sometimes when i don't eat correctly... it goes to 200.. is this something in need to tell my dr.  or is it something i can put off?
title: neuropathy
